card.name: Prisoner’s Dilemma
card.text: You and target opponent look at and then exile the top card of your libraries, face down. Declare its type, then reveal the exiled cards. If both players told the truth, both players scry 1 and then draw a card. If one player lied, that player draws a card. The other player discards a card. If both players lied, they both discard a card. Then each player puts the exiled card on the bottom of his or her library Exile this card.

card.name: Athena
card.text: Other white creatures you control have hexproof and indestructible.

card.name: BATNA
card.text: You may untap an attacking creature you control.

card.name: Chandler’s Law
card.text: Select a permanent you control. Search your library for copies of this card. You may put up to three copies in your hand.

card.name: Cool Off the Mark
card.text: Target creature does not untap during its controller’s next untap step.

card.name: Domain Seizure
card.text: Take control of target land.

card.name: Edward Snowden
card.text: Flying, hexproof

card.name: Eigenjesus
card.text: Flying Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

card.name: Frictionless Environment
card.text: Enchant land If enchanted land is untapped, creatures you control have vigilance.

card.name: Moral Therapeutic Deism
card.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to creatures you control this turn.

card.name: My Believies
card.text: Return target permanent you control that entered the graveyard this turn to your hand.

card.name: New Jim Crow
card.text: Choose a color. Permanents entering the battlefield of that color are exiled unless their controller pays 2.

card.name: Overton Window
card.text: Only spells with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of counters on Overton Window may be played. 1: Add a counter to Overton Window 1: Remove a counter from Overton Window.

card.name: Pluralistic Ignorance
card.text: Creatures you control that can attack this turn, must. Creatures defending opponents control who can block, must.

card.name: Precautionary Principle
card.text: At beginning of your end step, if all your permanents are untapped, you may play a card of converted mana cost equal to or less than the number of permanents you control from your hand without paying its mana cost.

card.name: Premature Optimization
card.text: Each player chooses a number of permanents he or she controls equal to the number of permanents controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest.

card.name: Quarantine
card.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can’t attack or block, and its activated abilities can’t be activated.

card.name: Regression to the Mean
card.text: Target creature gains +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Reparations
card.text: Put +1/+1 counters on a creature you control equal to the converted mana cost of a creature in your graveyard.

card.name: Sheep Dog
card.text: Vigilance, reach

card.name: Shit Umbrella
card.text: Equip 2 Equipped creature gains +0/+4. Damage that would be done to other creatures you control is instead dealt to equipped creature.

card.name: Status Panic
card.text: Creatures you control have +X/+0 until end of turn when attacking or blocking creatures of colors you do you control, where X is their power.

card.name: The Terrorist’s Dilemma
card.text: Enchant player Enchanted player puts cards from his or her library equal to the number of attacking creatures he or she controls into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Three-Body Problem
card.text: At most one creature may attack and one defend. Other declared attackers remain tapped but do not deal combat damage.

card.name: Trans-Pacific Parternship
card.text: Untap creatures you control. They gain +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: The Virtual God
card.text: Flash When The Virtual God enters the battlefield, remove all creatures from all graveyards and shuffle them back into their owners libraries.

card.name: Waiting for Godot
card.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gains Clueless (This creature cannot attack or block.)

card.name: @hewhocutsdown
card.text: +1: Draw two cards, then discard a card. -1: Return exiled card you control to your hand. -7: Exile the top six cards from any library. You may play any number of cards exiled this way without paying their mana cost.

card.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has shroud.

card.name: Alfred Thayer Mahan

card.name: Antilibrary
card.text: If you would draw the last card in your library, instead shuffle your graveyard into your library and draw a card.

card.name: Augmented Reality
card.text: Enchant land Enchanted land is a 2/2 Artifact Creature. It is still a land.

card.name: Backchannel
card.text: Exile a card you control. You may bring an exiled card onto the battlefield under your control.

card.name: Brandolini’s Law
card.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays 3.

card.name: Bruce Schneier
card.text: Shroud Scry 2 (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library. Put any number of them on the bottom of your library in any order and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Conlang
card.text: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can only be blocked by creatures that share a color with it.

card.name: Cyborgism
card.text: Creatures you control with equipment get +3/+3.

card.name: Dead Cow
card.text: Flash, hexproof

card.name: Diplomacy
card.text: All players reveal cards from their library until they reveal a nonland card, then exile a card from their hand, face down. Reveal exiled cards. The player with the exiled card of the highest converted mana cost may play the card revealed from the library without paying its mana cost. All other revealed cards go to their owner’s graveyards.

card.name: Eris
card.text: Indestructible 2T: Bid 5 for target permanent (All players put their hands aside and draw 5 cards. Each player bids the converted mana cost of a nonland card, and puts that card face down. All players reveal their bids, and place cards from their library into their graveyard equal to their bid. The player with the winning bid gains control of target permanent. In the event of a tie, no winner is declared. All players shuffle their cards back into their libraries.)

card.name: Eventually Consistent
card.text: Enchant player Enchanted player does not draw a card during his or her draw step. At the beginning of enchanted player’s end step, he or she draws a card.

card.name: Extended Cognition
card.text: Enchanted creature gets +0/+X where X is the number of artifacts you control.

card.name: Futurist

card.name: Glycon

card.name: Ideological Turing Test
card.text: Target creature becomes a copy of a different target creature until end of turn.

card.name: King Canute

card.name: Lies to Children
card.text: Scry 1 (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.) You may draw one card. If you do so, sacrifice a permanent you control.

card.name: Lisp Variant
card.text: Cascade (When you cast this spell, exile the top card of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library at random.) Draw three cards. Discard a card.

card.name: Satoshi Nakamoto
card.text: If Satoshi Nakamoto becomes the target of a spell or ability, exile it. At the beginning of your upkeep, if Satoshi Nakamoto is in exile, return it to the battlefield under your control. It has haste.

card.name: Methodological Anarchy
card.text: Each player may choose to name a card type at the beginning of their draw step. If they do, he or she reveals the card as they draw it. If the card type matches the type they chose, if it is a land they may put it on the battlefield; if it is a nonland they may play it without paying its mana cost. If the card is not the type that was named, put that card on the bottom of that player’s library, and then that player draws a card.
